title: The strict fines placed on Real Madrid stars as Zinedine Zidane hit players where it hurts
text:
The strict fines that Real Madrid's stars face for stepping out of line have been revealed.

Zinedine Zidane's squad contains some of the most prominent players in world football, including Eden Hazard, Gareth Bale and Sergio Ramos.

As reported by Deportes Cuatro (via Marca), players must turn up at least 45 minutes before training, with a series of fines imposed for lateness.

There are a series of strict fines in place for Zinedine Zidane's squad at Real Madrid

The fines include a charge of £223 for players who are five minutes late to training

Players that use mobile phones when they're not supposed to are charged up to £891

Players who are five minutes late are charged £223 (€250), with those who are 15 minutes late being fined £446 (€500).

Those who turn up even later are fined up to £891 (€1,000), with an unexplained absence from training setting a player back £2,674 (€3,000).

There are also fines regarding players using mobile phones in the dressing room, on the team coach or while being attended to by physios.

Players that are found to be overweight are fined £891 if they are repeat offenders

Any player not named in the matchday squad must be with the team before the game

Players can also be fined £891 if they don't inform the club of their intention to go outside Madrid on their day off

LIST OF FINES Training Five minutes late: £223 (€250) 15 minutes late: £446 (€500) More than 15 minutes late: £891 (€1,000) Unexplained absence from training: £2,674 (€3,000) Using mobile phones when not supposed to Initial fine: £223 (€250) Repeat offenders: Between £446 and £891 (€500 and €1,000) Not being weighed: £223 (€250) Being overweight: £891 (€1,000) (for repeat offenders) Failure to tell club of intention to go outside Madrid on a day off: Up to £891 (€1,000)

An initial fine of £223 (€250) could rise to between £446 and £891 (€500 and €1,000) for repeat offenders.

Players will have to pay £223 (€250) if they are not weighed, and being overweight could result in a fine of £891 (€1,000) for repeat offenders.

If players decide to go outside Madrid on a day off or are to take part in any interviews or commercial activities, they must inform the club beforehand. Failure to do so can lead to a fine of up to £891 (€1,000).

Gareth Bale will have received a fine as he turned up late to the game against Club Brugge

Another rule states that players not named in the matchday squad must be in the dressing room with the team before the start of the game and remain in the stadium until at least ten minutes before the match finishes.

Bale wasn't included in Real's squad for the 2-2 draw with Club Brugge in the Champions League this week, but the Welsh winger turned up four minutes late, meaning he will receive a fine.

Speaking after the game, Zidane, as reported by AS, said: 'That is something that remains in-house. You have information that you don't need to have.

'I have to speak to the player but I don't have to tell you what was said. I speak with the player, but you don't need to have this information.'
description: The strict fines that Real Madrid's stars face for stepping out of line have been revealed. Players must turn up at least 45 minutes before training, with a series of fines imposed for lateness.
